qas.question: How much of the Bronx's population is Hispanic?
How much of the Bronx's population is non-Hispanic Black?
How much of the Bronx's population is non-Hispanic White?
How much of the Bronx's population is non-Hispanic Asian?
How much of the Bronx's population is non-Hispanic multiracial?

context: According to the 2010 Census, <a0_0>53.5%<a0_0/> of Bronx's population was of Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish origin (they may be of any race); <a1_0>30.1%<a1_0/> non-Hispanic Black or African American, <a2_0>10.9%<a2_0/> of the population was non-Hispanic White, <a3_0>3.4%<a3_0/> non-Hispanic Asian, 0.6% from some other race (non-Hispanic) and <a4_0>1.2%<a4_0/> of two or more races (non-Hispanic). The U.S. Census considers the Bronx to be the most diverse area in the country. There is an 89.7 percent chance that any two residents, chosen at random, would be of different race or ethnicity.
